intro: Muraltia barkerae, commonly known as the Sierra Madre mallow, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are ovate and have a velvety texture, while its bark is smooth and grayish in appearance. Muraltia barkerae is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
